comments:
Hi!
i always get an exception with the find/replace command (launch in eclipse with
ctrl+f) in the term where i started eclipse : 

Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Reason:
String index out of range: 14

and in the .log file in <eclipseRoot>/workspace/.metadata/. there is the
following trace :

!SESSION oct. 30, 2002 09:45:16.182 --------------------------------------------
java.version=1.4.1

I asked an other user to launch the same eclipse, and to do a search/replace
with ctrl+f, but he got no errors (the search/replace window appears, and the
command ends with the correct result)
we tried to find the differences between our two workspace directory (for the
configuration): nothing but date and directory which are not the same.

any idea ?
Thanks Seiken.  I believe this is already fixed on HEAD.  SSQ to verify.

Yes, this is fixed in HEAD (Eclipse 2.1) and there is no plan
to fix in 2.0.2.

but why can an other user do the find/replace ?
i've just tried to launch eclipse in an other directory (so that a new workspace
is created), opened a new project, and added a new file (with something inside).
and then, to try a find/replace doesn't throw an error: it works well.

do you know which file is wrong (corrupted) in my workspace ? i mean a way to
find the wrong one(s).
an other solution is to remove my workspace, and import my projects; but it is
the same thing

Try changing your locale to english instead. It should work around
the problem.

I don't know which file causes the problem. It is probably the file
that keeps the history of the searches. This file belongs to the UI
team not SWT, so I don't know much about it.
